intro: Conostegia calocoma, commonly known as the silky conostegia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in humid, tropical environments. The plant is characterized by its smooth, grayish bark and clusters of small, fragrant white or yellowish flowers. Its leaves are usually opposite, elliptic in shape, and have a slightly hairy texture. Conostegia calocoma is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy or rocky soils.
